questions.question: Does each whoopie pie character retain a dark brown chocolate-colored outer layer?
questions.explanation: Image B features whoopie pie characters with outer layers illustrated using a dark brown color, representative of chocolate. The cartoon style clearly depicts the outer layer as chocolate-colored based on the standard visual representation of whoopie pies.

questions.question: Is there a visible white cream filling between the two chocolate halves of each whoopie pie character?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the whoopie pie characters are depicted in a cartoon style with a distinctly visible white filling between the dark brown chocolate halves, which aligns with the classic structure of whoopie pies.

questions.question: Does each whoopie pie character maintain a two-layered structure with an inner filling?
questions.explanation: Each whoopie pie character in Image B is designed with two brown layers sandwiching a white cream interior, maintaining the typical two-layered, filled structure seen in actual whoopie pies.

questions.question: Is there a white plate present beneath the whoopie pie characters?
questions.explanation: Image B shows whoopie pie characters placed on a white plate in both the top and bottom frames of the comic strip, making its presence obvious.

questions.question: Are at least two whoopie pie characters positioned on the edge of the plate?
questions.explanation: In the top frame of Image B, two whoopie pie characters are illustrated as standing on the edge of the plate, actively participating in the narrative.

questions.question: Are all whoopie pie characters circular in shape?
questions.explanation: The whoopie pie characters in Image B are represented with a circular shape, keeping true to the typical form of whoopie pies and reflecting the roundness seen in cartoon interpretations.

questions.question: Is there a clear contrast between the dark brown outer layers and the white inner filling of each whoopie pie character?
questions.explanation: There is a distinguished contrast evident in Image B between the dark brown outer layers and the white filling, indicative of the typical color contrast in whoopie pies which is well depicted in the cartoon strip.

questions.question: Do the chocolate tops of the whoopie pie characters show signs of surface cracking or texture?
questions.explanation: The cartoon depiction in Image B gives a smooth and clean representation of the whoopie pies without details of texture or cracking, contrary to typical real-life texture, probably to maintain the simplicity of the illustration.
